title: Which is the best Eurovision song that didn't qualify for the final? - Quora

response.answer_text: My two biggest “we was robbed” moments, I think, are Andorra’s “Salvem el mon” by the punk band Anonymous, and Estonia’s “Verona” by Koit Toome and Laura Põldvere. The former doubles as Andorra’s best entry by a very long margin, and should absolutely have made the final. I can’t help thinking of the sign which appeared during the broadcast of the final that year asking “Where’s Andorra????” The latter was undone - I maintain - via a microphone malfunction during one of the harmonies. I’ll admit I’m biased, since I would happily pay good money to hear Koit Toome sing anything, but I still feel they should have pressed for another chance at performing and may have got through. I have a much longer list of national final entries which never made it even as far as a semi-final if one happened to be on offer.

This may not be what you’re asking for. It’s a Eurovision song from before there were semifinals, and it didn’t even qualify to be the country’s entry. It was eliminated in the local “pre-Eurovision” contest. “Od Nagia,” 1985. “Anyone who has never in his life known love, anyone who has never in his life known pride— he must not harden his heart. His journey has not yet ended. His hour has yet to come.” Lyrics by Ehud Manor, music by Avi Toledano. Yardena Arazi singing.
